content: On November 17, 1997, the Atlanta Braves made a significant move by acquiring right-handed pitcher Kevin Millwood from the Philadelphia Phillies. This trade proved beneficial for the Braves, as Millwood would go on to become an integral part of their pitching staff, helping the team secure the 1999 National League pennant and earning a reputation as a reliable starter during his time in Atlanta. Millwood's presence contributed to the Braves' continued success in the late 1990s, showcasing the team's commitment to building a strong roster.
